meanings.definition: A flat, shallow container with a raised edge, used for carrying or holding items.
meanings.sent1: She carried the drinks on a tray to the table.
meanings.sent2: The waiter brought the food on a tray to our room.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to take a nap in the empty tray.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a tray of sunshine on a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The tray gleamed under the bright lights of the kitchen.

meanings.definition: A set of compartments for holding papers or documents.
meanings.sent1: He organized his bills in the different sections of the tray.
meanings.sent2: The teacher placed the graded papers neatly in the tray.
meanings.sent3: The tray of folders toppled over, creating a paper avalanche.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a tray overflowing with thoughts and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The tray on his desk was filled with important documents.

meanings.definition: To place items on a tray for serving or carrying.
meanings.sent1: She carefully trays the cupcakes for the party.
meanings.sent2: He trays the tools before starting the repair work.
meanings.sent3: The magician trays the cards with a flourish before the trick.
meanings.sent4: His words trays comfort to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The chef trays the dishes with precision and care.
